subject: Software Quality Assurance and Testing - Lecture 3
topic: UI Test Automation with Selenium WebDriver

questions.question: Which of the following best describes Selenium? [cite: 492]
options: A powerful tool for controlling web browsers through programs
A tool for testing Windows desktop applications only
A programming language for web development
questions.correct_answer: A powerful tool for controlling web browsers through programs

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT one of the four major components of Selenium? [cite: 494]
What is Selenium IDE primarily used for? [cite: 499]
options: Writing complex automation scripts in Java
Recording, editing, and debugging functional tests
questions.correct_answer: Recording, editing, and debugging functional tests

questions.question: Which Selenium component acts as a server that accepts commands via HTTP and is now considered legacy? [cite: 500]
How does Selenium WebDriver differ from Selenium RC? [cite: 502-503]
options: It uses a JavaScript injection technique
It sends commands directly to the browser via a browser-specific driver
It requires a server to be running before execution
questions.correct_answer: It sends commands directly to the browser via a browser-specific driver

questions.question: What is the function of Selenium Grid? [cite: 505]
options: To allow tests to use web browser instances running on remote machines
questions.correct_answer: To allow tests to use web browser instances running on remote machines

questions.question: In the Selenium WebDriver Architecture, what protocol is used for communication between language bindings and browser drivers? [cite: 514, 516]
Which interface is at the top of the Selenium Browser Driver Class Hierarchy? [cite: 518]
Which of the following is an example of a headless browser supported by Selenium? [cite: 525]
Which of the following is a major advantage of Selenium WebDriver regarding test execution time? [cite: 530]
options: It uses a faster internet connection

questions.question: Does Selenium WebDriver require a server to be started before executing test scripts? [cite: 533]
Which of the following is a limitation of Selenium WebDriver? [cite: 536-537]
options: It cannot test Windows-based desktop applications
questions.correct_answer: It cannot test Windows-based desktop applications

questions.question: What third-party tool is suggested for testing Windows-based applications alongside Selenium? [cite: 538]
How can image-based testing be performed with Selenium? [cite: 540]
Does Selenium WebDriver automatically generate test result files? [cite: 541]
options: No, it needs integration with frameworks like TestNG or JUnit
Yes, but only in the paid version
questions.correct_answer: No, it needs integration with frameworks like TestNG or JUnit

questions.question: Which elements cannot be automated using Selenium WebDriver? [cite: 543]
What is the recommended way to manage browser drivers automatically in the code? [cite: 579-581]
Which locator strategies locate elements whose visible text matches the search value? [cite: 596]
options: link text and partial link text
questions.correct_answer: link text and partial link text

questions.question: What is a key difference between XPath and CSS Selectors regarding traversal flow? [cite: 598-599]
options: XPath allows bidirectional flow (parent to child and child to parent)
Both allow only one directional flow
XPath allows only parent to child flow
questions.correct_answer: XPath allows bidirectional flow (parent to child and child to parent)

questions.question: Which is generally faster in terms of performance? [cite: 600]
options: It depends on the browser version

questions.question: Which feature does XPath have that CSS Selectors do not? [cite: 601-602]
options: Identification by visible text using text() function
questions.correct_answer: Identification by visible text using text() function

questions.question: In a customized CSS selector, what symbol represents the 'id' attribute? [cite: 604]
In a customized CSS selector, what symbol represents the 'class' attribute? [cite: 605]
Which of the following is a valid XPath expression format? [cite: 607]
What are the two types of XPath? [cite: 608]
What characterizes a Dynamic Table in HTML? [cite: 613]
options: Number of rows and columns are NOT fixed
questions.correct_answer: Number of rows and columns are NOT fixed

questions.question: Which class is used to launch the Chrome browser in Selenium WebDriver? [cite: 589]
What method is used to navigate to a specific URL in WebDriver? [cite: 595]
In the Selenium Driver class hierarchy, RemoteWebDriver implements which interface? [cite: 518]
Which tool enables the integration of Selenium with existing unit test frameworks to create automated tests? [cite: 501]
What file is used in Maven to manage dependencies like `selenium-java`? [cite: 546]
Which locator strategy locates elements matching a CSS selector? [cite: 596]
